abs: The use of the Gibbs sampler for Bayesian computation is reviewed and illustrated in the context of some canonical examples. Other Markov chain Monte Carlo simulation methods are also briefly described, and comments are made on the advantages of sample-based approaches for Bayesian inference summaries.
title: Bayesian Computation Via the Gibbs Sampler and Related Markov Chain Monte Carlo Methods
names: Journal of the Royal Statistical Society. Series B: Methodological
